The biggest benefit is that
```struct T
  a::A
  b::B
end```
is distinct from
```struct U
  a::A
  b::B
end```
To get that with NamedTuples, you need to use something like NamedNamedTuples.jl.

Related question: Is there a package that provides a macro akin to

```@as_nt struct MyStruct
    a::A
    b::B
end```
which creates a named tuple instead of a struct, but then adds the appropriate global variable such that you can still write `function f(x::MyStruct)` when writing code?

And because it's a named tuple and not a struct you can redefine it without having to restart your session?
